title: 'Africa Corps': Russia's Sahel presence rebranded
summary: Moscow is trying to recalibrate its policy toward Africa and erase memories of the Wagner Group label.

title: French foreign minister calls for Gaza truce in visit to Israel
summary: Catherine Colonna, on a diplomatic tour, called for an 'immediate and durable' truce in Gaza, with a view to a lasting ceasefire. Meanwhile, her Israeli counterpart Eli Cohen stated that France could play a 'significant role' in de-escalating tensions with Lebanon.

title: Southeast Asia becomes the epicenter for China's online fraud mafia
summary: The region is plagued by this new form of Chinese organized crime, whose modus operandi was revealed in the hit film 'No More Bets.' Online scams are now in the sights of the United Nations, Interpol and Western police forces.

title: Serbia: Governing populist party claims victory in parliamentary elections
summary: President Aleksandar Vucic claimed a sweeping victory Sunday in the country's parliamentary election, which was marred by reports of irregularities.

title: Chilean voters reject new constitution for the second time
summary: Voters rejected a proposed conservative constitution to replace the country's Pinochet-era charter on Sunday after having rejected a progressive draft in September 2022.

title: Guyana rekindles the world's thirst for oil
summary: Between 2020 and 2023, Guyanese oil production increased fivefold. The Latin American country with a population of 800,000 currently ranks 31st among oil-producing nations but could move up to 18th place by 2027.

title: In Japan, poverty and abuse are driving more young women to prostitution
summary: Non-profit organizations are trying to help these women, many of whom are teenagers. Authorities are showing little support for them.

title: Miss France winner Eve Gilles says her short hair a victory for 'diversity'
summary: Eve Gilles, the contestant representing the Nord-Pas-de-Calais region, was elected Miss France 2024 on Saturday evening.

title: How the Israel-Hamas war tore Harvard apart
summary: The conflict in the Middle East revealed the deep fractures tearing apart the prestigious American university, dramatically weakening the position of its new president, Claudine Gay, a progressive icon.

title: Posy Simmonds, comic book author: 'When I work under pressure, my mind makes sparks fly!'
summary: The empress of British graphic novels, creator of 'Gemma Bovery' and 'Tamara Drewe,' is the featured artist in a retrospective at the Public Information Library in Paris. This artist portrays the flaws of the English bourgeoisie like no other.

title: Swapping cameras for drones: The war effort of Ukraine's film industry
summary: Since Russia's invasion, costume designers transport clothes for troops, cinematographers operate drones, and others – actors, directors and producers – go into battle. Over 70 members of the Ukrainian film industry have lost their lives.

title: Suspected Channel migrant smuggler charged in France
summary: The man was charged and jailed with manslaughter, unintentional injury, deliberate endangerment and aiding illegal entry and residence, in an investigation into one of the two fatal incidents that led to the deaths of migrants in the English Channel last week.

title: Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic faces polls strong from EU's indulgence
summary: While openly aligning himself with the European Union, the pro-Russian leader has not given up on reclaiming Kosovo. He is confident of winning the early elections he called for, this Sunday.

title: Israel-Hamas war gives Egypt a chance to regain diplomatic influence
summary: Long relegated to a secondary role because of the growing influence of the Persian Gulf countries, Cairo is determined to make its presence felt in post-war Gaza.

title: Le Monde's top 10 destinations | #6 Italy's Bergamo
summary: Where to travel in 2024? This year, Le Monde answers that question with 10 travel picks accessible by train from France. Discover two travel guides per week throughout December. Number 6: 48 hours in Bergamo.

title: Hong Kong: Agnes Chow, the 'goddess of democracy,' forced into exile
summary: Just weeks before the trial of pro-democracy billionaire Jimmy Lai, activist Agnes Chow announced on social media her decision to depart her home country, where she faced the looming threat of trial, and relocate to Canada.

title: Teenager Alex Batty returns to UK after six-year disappearance
summary: The British teenager, who was found in France this week, flew back to the UK on Saturday, six years after he left home on what was meant to be a two-week family vacation in Spain.

title: Depardieu ready to hand back honor as minister says he 'shames France'
summary: The actor, who has faced new backlash after a documentary aired with new accusations of sexual violence and footage of misogynistic language, has been stripped of honors in Quebec and Belgium. A new 'disciplinary procedure' might also strip him of his Legion of Honor medal.

title: In the West Bank, released Palestinian prisoners are grateful but not loyal to Hamas
summary: Young former inmates of Israeli prisons, released in a swap for hostages in Gaza, discuss their connection with the Islamist movement and their aspirations for the future.

title: 'In Africa, the priority is developing artificial intelligence aligned with the continent's challenges'
summary: 'Le Monde Afrique' columnist Marie de Vergès notes that without investment in local skills, AI risks being ineffective in solving issues unique to Africa.

title: Israel-Hamas war: the shattered destinies of the French victims of October 7
summary: Pending the national tribute promised by President Emmanuel Macron, the full list of names of the French victims of Hamas's terrorist attack remains inaccessible. But some families have agreed to talk about their lost loved ones.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Telecom operators under high pressure
summary: The expected intensive use of smartphones is forcing operators to beef up their mobile networks. In stadiums, to avoid interference, airwaves will be closely monitored.

title: Angela Davis: 'Revolutions don't happen with a stroke of the clock'
summary: The famous American activist, who became a great intellectual, a theorist of intersectionality, and a defender of all oppressed minorities, looks back on her early awareness of 'the need to fight back' in the racist Alabama where she grew up.

title: Ligue 1: Leaders PSG draw with Lille while resurgent Marseille beat Clermont
summary: Canadian striker Jonathan David canceled out Kylian Mbappé's penalty with a last-minute goal. Marseille's two first-half goals were enough to beat bottom-side Clermont 2-1.

title: North Korea fires long-range ballistic missile capable of reaching US, according to officials
summary: North Korea resumed its major weapons test on Monday amidst escalating tensions and harsh exchanges with US-South Korean allies.

title: Jimmy Lai's landmark national security trial opens in Hong Kong
summary: The prominent media mogul and activist was arrested in 2020 on charges of colluding with foreign forces to endanger national security and conspiring with others to put out seditious publications.

title: Hundreds evacuated as record flooding hits northeastern Australia
summary: Roads were washed away, houses were submerged and crocodiles were swimming through towns after extreme flash flooding hit northern Queensland on Monday.

title: Destroying Hamas, or destroying Gaza?
summary: More than two months have still not brought Israel any definitive success against Hamas all while the Gaza Strip is being systematically destroyed at an exorbitant human cost to the population.

title: Make-or-break week for Macron's immigration bill
summary: A joint committee between the two chambers of Parliament will meet on Monday to try to find an agreement on the controversial bill. If the committee is inconclusive or if the text is once again rejected by the Assemblée, Macron said he would abandon it.

title:
Germany's AfD party wins first city
mayoral election in symbolic victory for far-right
summary: Alternative for Germany candidate Tim Lochner was elected mayor of Pirna on Sunday, a symbolic victory for the far-right party. The question of a possible ban on the movement is entering public debate.

title: French Foreign Affairs Ministry official killed by Israeli bombardment in Gaza
summary: Ahmed Abu Shamla, an employee of the Gaza consular office for over 20 years, died on Saturday. Part of his family had been evacuated from Gaza, but he had chosen to stay with his adult children.

title: The final verses of Gaza's poet Refaat Alareer
summary: Gazan intellectuals have been mourning the death of Refaat Alareer, professor of English literature and emblematic voice of Gaza, killed on December 6 during an Israeli bombardment.

title: French prosecutors seek life sentence for ex-wife of serial killer
summary: Monique Olivier is standing trial accused of involvement in the murders of two young women by her then-husband Michel Fourniret.

title: France FM set for Lebanon talks on calming Israel border
summary: French diplomats say Israeli bombardments have been intensifying, adding to fears of a major escalation.

title: France's interior minister weakened by political crisis over immigration bill
summary: Gérald Darmanin and the prime minister have to break the deadlock following the Assemblée Nationale's rejection of the government's controversial bill.

title: BP suspends Red Sea shipping transits after attacks
summary: BP has decided to halt all oil and gas shipments through Red Sea after its ships were attacked by Houthi rebels.

title: El-Sissi wins third term as Egypt's president
summary: Abdel Fattah El-Sissi won an overwhelming majority of votes to continue leading as president. The win means he will be in power until 2029, after which he won't be allowed to run again.

title: Calcutta brings Italy to its knees, with its French touch infused with progressive rock
summary: Highly popular in Italy since his 2015 album 'Mainstream,' the musician returns with 'RELAX,' an album that showcases a remarkable duality.

title: EU opens 'illegal content' probe into Elon Musk's X
summary: The EU launched proceedings on Monday after identifying disinformation related to Hamas's October 7 attack in Israel.

title: Pope Francis gives green light to blessings for same-sex couples
summary: Same-sex couples can now receive blessings from priests – as long as the ritual is not confused with the sacrament of marriage, which in the Catholic Church can only take place between a man and a woman.

title: Pope Francis gives green light to blessings for same-sex couples
summary: Same-sex couples can now receive blessings from priests – as long as the ritual is not confused with the sacrament of marriage, which in the Catholic Church can only take place between a man and a woman.

title: Record rainfall helps recharge France's water tables
summary: A December 14 report from the French Geological and Mining Research Bureau found that the situation was 'improving considerably.'

title: The drug mega-trial set to unveil the behind-the-scenes of European trafficking
summary: The drug trafficking trial held in Brussels from Monday, with 125 defendants of 15 different nationalities and a reinforced concrete bunker courthouse, is expected to last up to five months.

title: Bangladesh's prime minister has plunged her country into authoritarianism
summary: In power since 2009, Sheikh Hasina unleashed a full-scale crackdown on her opponents in the run-up to the January legislative elections. Since the end of July, 20,000 activists have been arrested and 88,000 others are facing legal action.

title: Paris barge owners still don't know what to expect for 2024 Olympics
summary: Despite the presentation of safety and traffic plans at the end of November, operators of floating restaurants, bars and nightclubs on the Seine are still unsure about the conditions under which they will be able to operate during the Olympic events.
